posts.name: mhartie
posts.cooked:
Add one month timeframe for disappearing messages.

For disappearing messages the time range is quite good (5 sec to 1 week). But I find that one week is too short. In many conversations I need to go back past a week. I think one month would be a great addition, enough time to be able to go back if needed but still short enough to keep the conversation history tidy.

link_counts.title: Signal iOS bug allows setting disappearing messages timer to more than 4 weeks
Extend time availability of 'Delete for Everyone' feature
Signal iOS bug allows setting disappearing messages timer to more than 4 weeks
Disappearance of messages with an option for a longer period
Signal iOS bug allows setting disappearing messages timer to more than 4 weeks
Increased or adjustable expiry time for stories
Getting to 0 GitHub issues in Signal-iOS

notice.raw: This request was initially about extending the duration to 4 weeks (which has since [been implemented](https://community.signalusers.org/t/longer-timeframe-more-options-for-disappearing-messages/2744/79)), but it is now used to discuss extending the range of options for disappearing messages in general, regardless of the specific time requested.
notice.cooked: This request was initially about extending the duration to 4 weeks (which has since been implemented), but it is now used to discuss extending the range of options for disappearing messages in general, regardless of the specific time requested.

posts.cooked:
Hello!

I agree, maybe 2 weeks, 1 month and 1 year could be added.

Better: just add a choice: customizable, where you can chose the number of days from 1-500 or so.

Kathy

If your goal is to keep your conversation history tidy then you might want to look into message trimming rather than disappearing messages. You can find it in Settings > Chats and media > Message trimming.

This is pretty customizable as well so you should be able to get exactly the degree of control you want.

posts.name: mhartie
posts.cooked: I would like my message history to actually disappear, ideally after a little bit of a longer period such as two weeks. I feel that no one really needs to look that far back and would like it erased from all devices, especially in group chats. But the message trimming sounds interesting. I couldn’t find the setting, is it available on the iOS Signal app?

mhartie:

I couldn’t find the setting, is it available on the iOS Signal app?

I’ve only used the Android and desktop apps so I’m not sure about this but considering how frequently feature parity across all platforms comes up when discussing features, it should be available on iOS as well.

Maybe someone else or a developer could confirm?

Having a customizable time would be great.

It would also be really useful if you could set a global default time, i.e. all chats use disappearing messages set to <CONFIGURED_DAYS> by default, unless overridden in a particular chat. That way I could for example choose 6 months as a general setting, and opt for a much shorter time for more sensitive chats.

For me the longer duration would be kind of a “peace of mind” / privacy setting, to know that messages aren’t lingering forever on various devices and/or servers by default. For this purpose a week is way too short, I regularly need to look up stuff from chats that goes back further (which I can easily do without even needing a search function due to the usually low or bursty volume).

posts.name: mhartie
posts.cooked: Good idea, a global timeframe for all messages and a per message timeframe for would be useful. Having a totally customizable timeframe for the disappearing messages would keep everyone happy.

I’d also like to see a longer time frame for disappearing messages (1 month). Some friends and I were talking and discussing about the fact that there are so many minor steps (5s, 10s, 30s etc) but when you reach 1 week theres no option anymore.

Sometimes 1 week is just too short, cause some information need to stay a bit longer.

The idea of message tirimming is is not sufficient in this case, because this feature only deletes them on my device but not on the others. Furthermore, eg. 200 messages may be the equivalent of a month long history of a simple p2p chat, but just 3 days in a group chat. Also, i can just set a global limit for trimming but not an individual one for each conversation.

posts.name: Dennis
posts.cooked:
ok not really a new feature. But I’d love to see the dissappearing messages threshold raised to a longer term

You could say this goes against the whole idea of dissappearing. But one weak is pretty short. For instance I wouldn’t want to delete messages of my significant other after just 1 week. 3 months would work fine however.

I’d bet it helps a good scrub for the signal servers if there would be a max of 12 months of storage unless specified.

What do you think?

Messages are not stored on Signal servers so this setting doesn’t affect them.

I do agree with raising the limit, if only to cater for other people’s usage models. I’m fine with 1 week as I only ever use it to send passwords so that’s more than enough.
For chat history culling, Signal has a setting I believe where it can start deleting old messages if the message count exceeds X, but if some people prefer doing the same task by message age rather than count, the option should perhaps be there.

Can a Signal Developer comment on this?
It is probably the easiest-to-implement feature request of all history, and I’ve not read of any counter-arguments here. (Speaking of adding more time frame options, not the global setting stuff also being discussed here.)
(See also #5775 on Github)

For me, the disappearing messages feature is completely worthless with the current set of options.
Please add, for example, 2 weeks, 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 13 months, 25 months *.

(* I propose 13 instead of 12 months in order to allow reading messages from a little more than a year ago, for example in cases like “I wonder where we met for aunt Alice’s birthday last year”)

link_counts.title: Add disappearing message time of 10 minutes by merge · Pull Request #6016 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub
Add disappearing message time of 3 weeks by narzb · Pull Request #6219 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub
Add 3 week and 12 week timeouts for disappearing messages by doozan · Pull Request #6814 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.cooked: @dingens, what should be purpose of this long time setting? To clean up your old messages on your phone? If this is the case you can turn on auto-deleting of old messages by setting (Android): Settings | Chat and media | Message trimming | Delete old messages and set subsequent settings.

Thank you p4nci.

I’m disappointed by moxie’s style of decision making. I’d definitely agree that discussing about 3 vs 4 weeks would be a bike shed discussion, but I don’t think the question whether a week is enough is one. Anyway, this has been discussed lots of times in lots of places and probably won’t change.

what should be purpose of this long time setting?

The exakt same purpose of the one-week setting: Not storing data longer than is necessary, as a means of improving privacy.
For me, necessary means: Long enough that I usually don’t notice it. And I very often scroll back to messages that are more than a week old.

I don’t understand why people (sadly this includes Signal devs) do see a urgent need to delete messages after five seconds (how would I even read them!?) or a few days, but the same people cannot imagine that other people would like to do the same thing after half a year. What is the magical thing that happens between the eigth and the thirteenth day? Can you explain it to me? (This is not sarcasm, I really don’t get it.)

@dingens, you would like to use disappearing messages to clean out the old messages. But why would you like to delete old messages from your friends phone too (what disappearing messages do)? Maybe your friend wants to keep messages longer then you do.

Now cleaning old messages is made when someone hits some number of messages (like I described above). Maybe there should be feature to delete old messages after some time passes like delete all of my messages on (my phone only!) after some period of time. This would be the feature to more precisely clean messages on users phone.

But in my humble opinion disappearing messages were made for completely different reason. To delete secret message send between sender and receiver. For example:

  • Activist sends message to another activist: “We will meet at parliament at 10 AM. Tell other friend to come to the protest.” And after like a minute the message is deleted on both phones, sender and receiver.
  • I have used disappearing messages to send password to admin and wrote: “Please copy this password into password manager immediately.” Then message is deleted from both phones.
  • I have a friend which he got divorced from controlling wife. They have 10 years old child. Ex-wife checks child phone regularly and so what ever he and his child text is inspected. To make sure noone else is reading texting between him and his child, he uses disappearing messages.

I think disappearing messages have a functionality that should not be mistaken for cleaning messages on users phone. For this purpose I think it would be much better to make a functionality to enable like per user or system wide how long messages should be kept.

I’ll just add that I too would like to see the option of a longer or custom timeframe for disappearing messages. The options I propose would be as follows:

  • 10 seconds
  • 1 minute
  • 5 minutes
  • 30 minutes
  • 1 hour
  • 6 hours
  • 12 hours
  • 1 day
  • 1 week
  • custom (perhaps entered in units of seconds)

My thoughts on this. I would love to see message trimming on iOS, seems like this is an Android only feature (there is a feature request for Desktop equivalent of message trimming). I do like the fact that message trimming is one side only and not for all group members such as disappearing messages.

Additionally,

Signalize:

Furthermore, eg. 200 messages may be the equivalent of a month long history of a simple p2p chat, but just 3 days in a group chat.

it might be a good idea to add a trim limit instead of just a time limit. E.g., I want to set how many messages I want to retain per chat rather than set a fixed time period. For example I want to keep messages from a contact I interact only a few times in a year but delete all messages in a chat that I would not scroll through anyway.

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
klajsdgasjg:

add a trim limit instead of just a time limit.

The already existing message trimming on Android does exactly that. You set it to delete old messages when conversations are > N messages.

So what you want is to have that feature on iOS.

Also, this feature request is about disappearing messages, and not message trimming, so idk why you put your post here. Those are two distinct features.

posts.name: Carol Kennedy
posts.cooked:
the HUGE difference between disappearing messages and conversation trimming is that the former is symmetric, while the latter is subjective.
I’d like to have a good time frame for disappearing messages (e.g. 1, 2, 3, 6 months) but I’d like to be CERTAIN that my friends will have to have the same.
I could trim conversations on my device, but I know that my friends wouldn’t, and so my security would be one-sided.

I strongly hope we’ll have longer expiration disappearing messages, soon!
thanks. cheers
